children.subject: I took 61C in Fall 2018 with Garcia/Nikolic, 161 in Spring 2019 with Weaver/Popa, and 188 in Fall 2018 with Abbeel/Klein. I'd say the workload for 61C/161 was very similar (light homework with some medium projects and medium exams), and both had slightly higher workloads than 188.

history.content: You might want to contact the 161 course staff directly and ask about workload since they might be changing up things due to being online. For instance, 61c this summer added required lectures 'mini quizzes' on gradescope for all lectures due in ~2 days. These were supposed to replace i-clicker questions because all lectures are per-recorded. I find these helpful for an online course but some students said it added more work.

You might want to contact the 161 course staff directly and ask about workload since they might be changing up things due to being online. For instance, 61c this summer added required lectures 'mini quizzes' on gradescope for all lectures due in ~2 days. These were supposed to replace i-clicker questions because all lectures are per-recorded. I find these helpful but some students said it added more work.

children.subject:
I personally think 161 is easier conceptually than 61C and 188, but the projects are comparable to the current 61C projects and certainly harder than the 188 projects.

All our changes from making the course online are intended to make the course easier and less stressful for students (the biggest one is homeworks now give instant feedback like 61C and 188). There might be some extra optional assignments, but we have no plans on increasing the workload for an online version of the class.

history.content: How does the workload of 161 with weaver compare to 61c Garcia (which I personally found to be not as easy intuitively, but still did well on), 188 Rao/Lambert? Just trying to adjust my class schedule
history.subject: Workload of 161 with Weaver
